trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement iOS SDK Reach Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement iOS SDK Reach Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on iOS document before following this guide.
trans-unit.target: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on iOS document before following this guide.

trans-unit.source: Add the Reach sdk in your Xcode project.
trans-unit.target: Add the Reach sdk in your Xcode project.

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, go to Project \> Add to project and choose the EngagementReach folder.
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, go to Project \> Add to project and choose the EngagementReach folder.

trans-unit.source: At the top of your implementation file, import the Engagement Reach module:
trans-unit.target: At the top of your implementation file, import the Engagement Reach module:

trans-unit.source: Inside method applicationDidFinishLaunching: or application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:, create a reach module and pass it to your existing Engagement initialization line:
trans-unit.target: Inside method applicationDidFinishLaunching: or application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:, create a reach module and pass it to your existing Engagement initialization line:

trans-unit.source: Modify 'icon.png' string with the image name you want as your notification icon.
trans-unit.target: Modify 'icon.png' string with the image name you want as your notification icon.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the option Update badge value in Reach campaigns or if you want to use native push \ campaigns, you must let the Reach module manage the badge icon itself (it will automatically clear the application badge and also reset the value stored by Engagement every time the application is started or foregrounded). This is done by adding the following line after Reach module initialization:
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the option Update badge value in Reach campaigns or if you want to use native push \ campaigns, you must let the Reach module manage the badge icon itself (it will automatically clear the application badge and also reset the value stored by Engagement every time the application is started or foregrounded). This is done by adding the following line after Reach module initialization:

trans-unit.source: If you want to handle Reach data push, you must let your Application delegate conform to the AEReachDataPushDelegate protocol.
trans-unit.target: If you want to handle Reach data push, you must let your Application delegate conform to the AEReachDataPushDelegate protocol.

trans-unit.source: Add the following line after Reach module initialization:
trans-unit.target: Add the following line after Reach module initialization:

trans-unit.source: Then you can implement the methods onDataPushStringReceived: and onDataPushBase64ReceivedWithDecodedBody:andEncodedBody: in your application delegate:
trans-unit.target: Then you can implement the methods onDataPushStringReceived: and onDataPushBase64ReceivedWithDecodedBody:andEncodedBody: in your application delegate:

trans-unit.source: The category parameter is optional when you create a Data Push campaign and allows you to filter data pushes.
trans-unit.target: The category parameter is optional when you create a Data Push campaign and allows you to filter data pushes.

trans-unit.source: This is useful if you want to push different kinds of Base64 data and want to identify their type before parsing them.
trans-unit.target: This is useful if you want to push different kinds of Base64 data and want to identify their type before parsing them.

trans-unit.source: Your application is now ready to receive and display reach contents!
trans-unit.target: Your application is now ready to receive and display reach contents!

trans-unit.source: Engagement can send Reach notifications to your end users at any time by using the Apple Push Notification Service.
trans-unit.target: Engagement can send Reach notifications to your end users at any time by using the Apple Push Notification Service.

trans-unit.source: To enable this functionality, you'll have to prepare your application for Apple push notifications and modify your application delegate.
trans-unit.target: To enable this functionality, you'll have to prepare your application for Apple push notifications and modify your application delegate.

trans-unit.source: Please follow the guide : How to Prepare your Application for Apple Push Notifications.
trans-unit.target: Please follow the guide : How to Prepare your Application for Apple Push Notifications.

trans-unit.source: At this point your application should have a registered Apple push certificate in the Engagement frontend.
trans-unit.target: At this point your application should have a registered Apple push certificate in the Engagement frontend.

trans-unit.source: If it's not done already, you need to register your application to receive push notifications.
trans-unit.target: If it's not done already, you need to register your application to receive push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Add the following line when your application starts (typically in application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:):
trans-unit.target: Add the following line when your application starts (typically in application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:):

trans-unit.source: Then, You need to provide to Engagement the device token returned by Apple servers.
trans-unit.target: Then, You need to provide to Engagement the device token returned by Apple servers.

trans-unit.source: This is done in the method named application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken: in your application delegate:
trans-unit.target: This is done in the method named application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken: in your application delegate:

trans-unit.source: Finally, you have to inform the Engagement SDK when your application receives a remote notification.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you have to inform the Engagement SDK when your application receives a remote notification.

trans-unit.source: To do that, call the method applicationDidReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler: in your application delegate:
trans-unit.target: To do that, call the method applicationDidReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler: in your application delegate:

trans-unit.source: The method above is introduced in iOS 7. If you are targeting iOS <7, make sure to implement method application:didReceiveRemoteNotification: in your application delegate and call applicationDidReceiveRemoteNotification on the EngagementAgent by passing nil instead of the handler argument:
trans-unit.target: The method above is introduced in iOS 7. If you are targeting iOS <7, make sure to implement method application:didReceiveRemoteNotification: in your application delegate and call applicationDidReceiveRemoteNotification on the EngagementAgent by passing nil instead of the handler argument:

trans-unit.source: By default, Engagement Reach controls the completionHandler.
trans-unit.target: By default, Engagement Reach controls the completionHandler.

trans-unit.source: If you want to manually respond to the handler block in your code, you can pass nil for the handler argument and control the completion block yourself.
trans-unit.target: If you want to manually respond to the handler block in your code, you can pass nil for the handler argument and control the completion block yourself.

trans-unit.source: See the UIBackgroundFetchResult type for a list of possible values.
trans-unit.target: See the UIBackgroundFetchResult type for a list of possible values.

trans-unit.source: Here is a full example of integration:
trans-unit.target: Here is a full example of integration:

trans-unit.source: There are two types of notifications: system and in-app notifications.
trans-unit.target: There are two types of notifications: system and in-app notifications.

trans-unit.source: System notifications are handled by iOS, and cannot be customized.
trans-unit.target: System notifications are handled by iOS, and cannot be customized.

trans-unit.source: In-app notifications are made of a view that is dynamically added to the current application window.
trans-unit.target: In-app notifications are made of a view that is dynamically added to the current application window.

trans-unit.source: This is called a notification overlay.
trans-unit.target: This is called a notification overlay.

trans-unit.source: Notification overlays are great for a fast integration because they does not require you to modify any view in your application.
trans-unit.target: Notification overlays are great for a fast integration because they does not require you to modify any view in your application.

trans-unit.source: To modify the look of your in-app notifications, you can simply modify the file AENotificationView.xib to your needs, as long as you keep the tag values and types of the existing subviews.
trans-unit.target: To modify the look of your in-app notifications, you can simply modify the file AENotificationView.xib to your needs, as long as you keep the tag values and types of the existing subviews.

trans-unit.source: By default, in-app notifications are presented at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: By default, in-app notifications are presented at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to display them at the top of screen, edit the provided AENotificationView.xib and change the AutoSizing property of the main view so it can be kept at the top of its superview.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to display them at the top of screen, edit the provided AENotificationView.xib and change the AutoSizing property of the main view so it can be kept at the top of its superview.

trans-unit.source: When you modify the provided layout, you modify the look of all your notifications.
trans-unit.target: When you modify the provided layout, you modify the look of all your notifications.

trans-unit.source: Categories allow you to define various targeted looks (possibly behaviors) for notifications.
trans-unit.target: Categories allow you to define various targeted looks (possibly behaviors) for notifications.

trans-unit.source: A category can be specified when you create a Reach campaign.
trans-unit.target: A category can be specified when you create a Reach campaign.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that categories also let you customize announcements and polls, that is described later in this document.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that categories also let you customize announcements and polls, that is described later in this document.

trans-unit.source: To register a category handler for your notifications, you need to add a call once the reach module is initialized.
trans-unit.target: To register a category handler for your notifications, you need to add a call once the reach module is initialized.

trans-unit.source: myNotifier must be an instance of an object that conforms to the protocol AENotifier.
trans-unit.target: myNotifier must be an instance of an object that conforms to the protocol AENotifier.

trans-unit.source: You can implement the protocol methods by yourself or you can choose to reimplement the existing class AEDefaultNotifier which already performs most of the work.
trans-unit.target: You can implement the protocol methods by yourself or you can choose to reimplement the existing class AEDefaultNotifier which already performs most of the work.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to redefine the notification view for a specific category, you can follow this example:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to redefine the notification view for a specific category, you can follow this example:

trans-unit.source: This simple example of category assume that you have a file named MyNotificationView.xib in your main application bundle.
trans-unit.target: This simple example of category assume that you have a file named MyNotificationView.xib in your main application bundle.

trans-unit.source: If the method is not able to find a corresponding .xib, the notification will not be displayed and Engagement will output a message in the console.
trans-unit.target: If the method is not able to find a corresponding .xib, the notification will not be displayed and Engagement will output a message in the console.

trans-unit.source: The provided nib file should respect the following rules:
trans-unit.target: The provided nib file should respect the following rules:

trans-unit.source: It should only contain one view.
trans-unit.target: It should only contain one view.

trans-unit.source: Subviews should be of the same types as the ones inside the provided nib file named AENotificationView.xib
trans-unit.target: Subviews should be of the same types as the ones inside the provided nib file named AENotificationView.xib

trans-unit.source: Subviews should have the same tags as the ones inside the provided nib file named AENotificationView.xib
trans-unit.target: Subviews should have the same tags as the ones inside the provided nib file named AENotificationView.xib

trans-unit.source: Just copy the provided nib file, named AENotificationView.xib, and start working from there.
trans-unit.target: Just copy the provided nib file, named AENotificationView.xib, and start working from there.

trans-unit.source: But be careful, the view inside this nib file is associated to the class AENotificationView.
trans-unit.target: But be careful, the view inside this nib file is associated to the class AENotificationView.

trans-unit.source: This class redefined the method layoutSubViews to move and resize its subviews according to context.
trans-unit.target: This class redefined the method layoutSubViews to move and resize its subviews according to context.

trans-unit.source: You may want to replace it with an UIView or you custom view class.
trans-unit.target: You may want to replace it with an UIView or you custom view class.

trans-unit.source: If you need deeper customization of your notifications(if you want for instance to load your view directly from the code), it is recommended to take a look at the provided source code and class documentation of Protocol ReferencesDefaultNotifier and AENotifier.
trans-unit.target: If you need deeper customization of your notifications(if you want for instance to load your view directly from the code), it is recommended to take a look at the provided source code and class documentation of Protocol ReferencesDefaultNotifier and AENotifier.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can use the same notifier for multiple categories.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can use the same notifier for multiple categories.

trans-unit.source: You can also redefined the default notifier like this:
trans-unit.target: You can also redefined the default notifier like this:

trans-unit.source: When using the default category, some life cycle methods are called on the AEReachContent object to report statistics and update the campaign state:
trans-unit.target: When using the default category, some life cycle methods are called on the AEReachContent object to report statistics and update the campaign state:

trans-unit.source: When the notification is displayed in application, the displayNotification method is called (which reports statistics) by AEReachModule if handleNotification: returns YES.
trans-unit.target: When the notification is displayed in application, the displayNotification method is called (which reports statistics) by AEReachModule if handleNotification: returns YES.

trans-unit.source: If the notification is dismissed, the exitNotification method is called, statistic is reported and next campaigns can now be processed.
trans-unit.target: If the notification is dismissed, the exitNotification method is called, statistic is reported and next campaigns can now be processed.

trans-unit.source: If the notification is clicked, actionNotification is called, statistic is reported and the associated action is performed.
trans-unit.target: If the notification is clicked, actionNotification is called, statistic is reported and the associated action is performed.

trans-unit.source: If your implementation of AENotifier bypasses the default behavior, you have to call these life cycle methods by yourself.
trans-unit.target: If your implementation of AENotifier bypasses the default behavior, you have to call these life cycle methods by yourself.

trans-unit.source: The following examples illustrate some cases where the default behavior is bypassed:
trans-unit.target: The following examples illustrate some cases where the default behavior is bypassed:

trans-unit.source: You don't extend AEDefaultNotifier, e.g. you implemented category handling from scratch.
trans-unit.target: You don't extend AEDefaultNotifier, e.g. you implemented category handling from scratch.

trans-unit.source: You overrode prepareNotificationView:forContent:, be sure to map at least onNotificationActioned or onNotificationExited to one of your U.I controls.
trans-unit.target: You overrode prepareNotificationView:forContent:, be sure to map at least onNotificationActioned or onNotificationExited to one of your U.I controls.

trans-unit.source: If handleNotification: throws an exception, the content is deleted and drop is called, this is reported in statistics and next campaigns can now be processed.
trans-unit.target: If handleNotification: throws an exception, the content is deleted and drop is called, this is reported in statistics and next campaigns can now be processed.

trans-unit.source: Overlays are great for a fast integration but can be sometimes not convenient, or can have unwanted side effects.
trans-unit.target: Overlays are great for a fast integration but can be sometimes not convenient, or can have unwanted side effects.

trans-unit.source: If you're not satisfied with the overlay system in some of your views, you can customize it for these views.
trans-unit.target: If you're not satisfied with the overlay system in some of your views, you can customize it for these views.

trans-unit.source: You can decide to include our notification layout in your existing views.
trans-unit.target: You can decide to include our notification layout in your existing views.

trans-unit.source: To do so, there is two implementation styles:
trans-unit.target: To do so, there is two implementation styles:

trans-unit.source: Add the notification view using interface builder
trans-unit.target: Add the notification view using interface builder

trans-unit.source: Open Interface Builder
trans-unit.target: Open Interface Builder

trans-unit.source: Place a 320x60 (or 768x60 if you are on iPad) UIView where you want the notification to appear
trans-unit.target: Place a 320x60 (or 768x60 if you are on iPad) UIView where you want the notification to appear

trans-unit.source: Set the Tag value for this view to : 36822491
trans-unit.target: Set the Tag value for this view to : 36822491

trans-unit.source: Add the notification view programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Add the notification view programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Just add the following code when your view has been initialized:
trans-unit.target: Just add the following code when your view has been initialized:

trans-unit.source: NOTIFICATION_AREA_VIEW_TAG macro can be found in AEDefaultNotifier.h.
trans-unit.target: NOTIFICATION_AREA_VIEW_TAG macro can be found in AEDefaultNotifier.h.

trans-unit.source: The default notifier automatically detects that the notification layout is included in this view and will not add an overlay for it.
trans-unit.target: The default notifier automatically detects that the notification layout is included in this view and will not add an overlay for it.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the files AEDefaultAnnouncementView.xib and AEDefaultPollView.xib as long as you keep the tag values and types of the existing subviews.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the files AEDefaultAnnouncementView.xib and AEDefaultPollView.xib as long as you keep the tag values and types of the existing subviews.

trans-unit.source: Like notifications, the campaign's category can be used to have alternate layouts for your announcements and polls.
trans-unit.target: Like notifications, the campaign's category can be used to have alternate layouts for your announcements and polls.

trans-unit.source: To create a category for an announcement, you must extend AEAnnouncementViewController and register it once the reach module has been initialized:
trans-unit.target: To create a category for an announcement, you must extend AEAnnouncementViewController and register it once the reach module has been initialized:

trans-unit.source: Each time a user will click on a notification for an announcement with the category "my\_category", your registered view controller (in that case MyCustomAnnouncementViewController) will be initialized by calling the method initWithAnnouncement: and the view will be added to the current application window.
trans-unit.target: Each time a user will click on a notification for an announcement with the category "my\_category", your registered view controller (in that case MyCustomAnnouncementViewController) will be initialized by calling the method initWithAnnouncement: and the view will be added to the current application window.

trans-unit.source: In your implementation of the AEAnnouncementViewController class you will have to read the property announcement to initialize your subviews.
trans-unit.target: In your implementation of the AEAnnouncementViewController class you will have to read the property announcement to initialize your subviews.

trans-unit.source: Consider the example below, where two labels are initialized using title and body properties of the AEReachAnnouncement class:
trans-unit.target: Consider the example below, where two labels are initialized using title and body properties of the AEReachAnnouncement class:

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to load your views by yourself but you just want to reuse the default announcement view layout, you can simply make your custom view controller extends the provided class AEDefaultAnnouncementViewController.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to load your views by yourself but you just want to reuse the default announcement view layout, you can simply make your custom view controller extends the provided class AEDefaultAnnouncementViewController.

trans-unit.source: In that case, duplicate the nib file AEDefaultAnnouncementView.xib and rename it so it can be loaded by your custom view controller (for a controller named CustomAnnouncementViewController, you should call your nib file CustomAnnouncementView.xib).
trans-unit.target: In that case, duplicate the nib file AEDefaultAnnouncementView.xib and rename it so it can be loaded by your custom view controller (for a controller named CustomAnnouncementViewController, you should call your nib file CustomAnnouncementView.xib).

trans-unit.source: To replace the default category of announcements, simply register your custom view controller for the category defined in kAEReachDefaultCategory:
trans-unit.target: To replace the default category of announcements, simply register your custom view controller for the category defined in kAEReachDefaultCategory:

trans-unit.source: Polls can be customized the same way :
trans-unit.target: Polls can be customized the same way :

trans-unit.source: This time, the provided MyCustomPollViewController must extend AEPollViewController.
trans-unit.target: This time, the provided MyCustomPollViewController must extend AEPollViewController.

trans-unit.source: Or you can choose to extend from the default controller: AEDefaultPollViewController.
trans-unit.target: Or you can choose to extend from the default controller: AEDefaultPollViewController.

trans-unit.source: Don't forget to call either action (submitAnswers: for custom poll view controllers) or exit method before the view controller is dismissed.
trans-unit.target: Don't forget to call either action (submitAnswers: for custom poll view controllers) or exit method before the view controller is dismissed.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, statistics won't be sent (i.e. no analytics on the campaign) and more importantly next campaigns will not be notified until the application process is restarted.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, statistics won't be sent (i.e. no analytics on the campaign) and more importantly next campaigns will not be notified until the application process is restarted.

trans-unit.source: In this implementation the custom announcement view is loaded from an external xib file.
trans-unit.target: In this implementation the custom announcement view is loaded from an external xib file.

trans-unit.source: Like for advanced notification customization, it is recommended to look at the source code of the standard implementation.
trans-unit.target: Like for advanced notification customization, it is recommended to look at the source code of the standard implementation.

trans-unit.source: CustomAnnouncementViewController.h
trans-unit.target: CustomAnnouncementViewController.h
